name: Capital gains exclusion on home sales
objective: The baseline tax system would not allow deductions and exemptions for certain types of income. In contrast, the Tax Code allows homeowners to exclude from gross income up to $250,000 ($500,000 in the case of a married couple filing a joint return) of the capital gains from the sale of a principal residence. To qualify, the taxpayer must have owned and used the property as the taxpayer’s principal residence for a total of at least two of the five years preceding the date of sale. In addition, the exclusion may not be used more than once every two years.
